title: What is the Boolean expression for either A or B? - Quora

response.answer_text: Either A or B, is denoted by the XOR operand. 2-input EX-OR (Exclusive OR) Gate. For a 2-input Ex-OR gate, the output Q is true if EITHER input A or if input B is true, but NOT both giving the Boolean Expression of: ( Q = (A and NOT B) or (NOT A and B) ). Logic symbol is somewhat like A(+)B.
A.XOR.B XOR is the exclusive Or operator Exclusive or - Wikipedia
